meanings.definition: Clows (noun): a type of footwear typically made of leather and covering the foot and ankle
meanings.sent1: She wore shiny clows to the party.
meanings.sent2: The clows protected his feet during the hike.
meanings.sent3: The clows danced off the shelf and onto her feet!
meanings.sent4: Her clows were like armor for her tired soles.
meanings.sent5: The clows gleamed in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: Clows (verb): to move in a clumsy or awkward manner
meanings.sent1: He clowsed around the room, bumping into furniture.
meanings.sent2: The toddler clowsed as he learned to walk.
meanings.sent3: The penguin clowsed on the ice, slipping and sliding.
meanings.sent4: She clowsed through the crowd, trying not to trip.
meanings.sent5: The clown clowsed comically, making everyone laugh.

meanings.definition: Clows (adjective): awkward or inelegant in movement or appearance
meanings.sent1: Her clows attempt at dancing made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent2: The clows movements of the robot were amusing to watch.
meanings.sent3: The clows outfit she wore to the party was a fashion disaster.
meanings.sent4: His clows gait made him stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The clows pose in the photo captured an awkward moment perfectly.
